results.title: The Treasure of Sierra Madre
results.creator_credit: John Huston, Henry Blanke and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: John Huston won Academy Awards both as director and writer of this film. Based on B. Traven’s novel, it reveals the effects of greed and the lure of sudden wealth on three penniless prospectors. Humphrey Bogart, as Fred C. Dobbs, gives one of the best performances of his career. We watch him change from a likeable drifter into a man capable of killing his best friend in cold blood.

results.title: To have and have not
results.creator_credit: Howard Hawks, Jack L. Warner and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Lauren Bacall’s sizzling screen debut in “To have and have not” also marked her first role opposite Humphrey Bogart. The film that brought this legendary couple together is an adaptation of the Ernest Hemingway novel, set on the German controlled island of Martinique during World War II. The compelling script by Jules Furthman and William Faulkner captures the drama of the war-torn 40’s and is peppered with witticisms and wisecracks. Supporting players Walter Brennan and Hoagy Carmichael keep the action brisk, but the scenes between sullen Bogie and silky Bacall exude a heat and humour that pervade the entire picture.

results.title: At the circus
results.creator_credit: Edward Buzzell, Mervyn LeRoy and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A shyster lawyer and two incompetents save a circus from bankruptcy while a man-eating gorilla and the combined unmistakable talents of a tattooed lady and a crazy musical conductor move the plot foward at a furious pace. Blending all that is ridiculous and crazy this movie is one of the Marx Bros classics. Cast also includes Eve Arden, Margaret Dumont, Nat Pendleton, Fritz Feld.

results.title: Swiss miss
results.creator_credit: John G. Blystone, Hal Roach and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Comic operetta in which Laurel and Hardy are mousetrap salesmen in Switzerland. They can’t pay their dinner bill and wind up working in the hotel kitchen to pay expenses. Their stay coincides with the local music festival and they have to contend with a gorilla, two opera singers, a St. Bernard dog and moving a piano up a narrow mountain trail. Based on the original story by Jean Negulesco and Charles Rogers.

results.title: The Dawn patrol
results.creator_credit: Edmund Goulding, Turner Entertainment and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Errol Flynn and David Niven are daring, roustabout fighter pilot buddies, who whether quaffing down ales with their squadron or gunning down their German foes, unite in devil-may-care gallantry and a spirit of camaraderie that is easy to understand. They quickly snap-to as they come face to face with the harsh realities of war, learning a great deal about friendship, heroism and patriotism in the process. During the fateful months of 1915, the average life of combat pilots over the western front was only four and a half flying hours, as raw and hastily trained recruits were sent up in a constant deadly chain to almost certain death, as soon as they reported for duty. Basil Rathbone and Donald Crisp co-star as grounded commandants whose duty it is to send these fresh faced recruits to their flying deaths. A splendid remake of Howard Hawks’ 1930 Oscar winner, this film aptly captures the pervading tone of wartime camaraderie and the gruelling pressures of battlefront command, and remains at the top of Hollywood’s finest aviation epics.

results.title: Picnic
results.creator_credit: Joshua Logan, Fred Kohlmar and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on William Inge’s Pulitzer Prize winning Broadway hit, “Picnic” is a revealing look into the hearts and minds of a select group of Kansas townfolk over Labor Day weekend. This simple yet poignant story stars William Holden as an itinerant drifter who swings into town, stirring up trouble and awakening the interest of Kim Novak. At first, Holden refused the role - considering himself too old for the part at 37. However, his outstanding performance proved critical to the film’s success, and his love scenes with Novak are considered to be among the most sensual in cinema history. Co-starring Susan Strasberg, Rosalind Russell and Cliff Robertson, “Picnic” was nominated for several and also won two Academy Awards.

results.title: The Virgin queen
results.creator_credit: Henry Koster, Charles Brackett and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Bette Davis gives her second memorable performance as Queen Elizabeth I in this swashbuckling historical drama that also features Joan Collins in an early screen performance. It is the story of the aging queen’s attraction to handsome Sir Walter Raleigh (Richard Todd) and her bitter clash with a scheming, younger rival (Collins). Rich in historical detail, lavish with authentic cotumes and period decor and enlivened by thrilling swordplay, “The Virgin Queen” is a legendary re-creation of one of England’s most fascinating eras, made all the more alluring by Davis’ dynamic performance.

results.title: Pin up girl
results.creator_credit: Bruce Humberstone, William Le Baron and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Gorgeous Betty Grable (voted the Armed Forces’ favourite pin up girl), stars as a War Department typist, who doubles as a small-time USO entertainer desperate for a chance at the big-time. Her penchant for telling lies gets her into all sorts of trouble especially when she fibs her way into the company of war hero Tommy Dooley (John Harvey) by pretending to be a musical star. Her life gets more complicated when she is appointed secretary to the handsome war hero. Barely disguised, she manages to fool him for a time, but not when she flashes those million dollar legs! Grable turns in a wonderful performance and there are several excellent musical numbers.

results.title: Springtime in the Rockies
results.creator_credit: Irving Cummings, William Le Baron and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Betty Grable abandons Broadway fame and takes off for the beautiful Canadian Rockies after she has a falling out with her leading man (John Payne). All manner of complications arise when Payne pursues her with a highly unlikely secretary (Carmen Miranda) in tow. In the Rockies, Grable meets up with a former dance partner (Cesar Romero) and decides to teach philandering Payne a lesson in the art of two-timing. The two women lead the men a merry dance in this colourful musical. Carmen Miranda proves to be a fine comedienne with her fractured English and Grable and Romero set the screen ablaze with some wonderful dance routines. Several hit songs are featured in this tuneful showcase.

results.title: Moon over Miami
results.creator_credit: Walter Lang, Harry Joe Brown and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: When two sisters (played by Betty Grable and Carole Landis) fail to receive an expected inheritance, they decide to pool their resources with their Aunt and head for Florida, posing as an heiress, a secretary and a maid in the hopes of ensnaring a couple of millionaires. Grable is soon involved with two, Don Ameche and Robert Cummings, but all is not what it seems. Ameche is just as broke as the girls, but woos gold-digger Grable with his smooth talk and charming ways, with genuine millionaire Cummings in hot pursuit. A bright and breezy song-filled musical, as Grable turns in some fine dance routines with the Condos Brothers. Fabulous comic performances from the cast help make this film one of the best Hollywood musicals of its era.
